definition: unswerving from start to finish (idiom)
to begin/to start/then/only then
end/finish
as/as if/such as
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: He needs also to identify the opponent more clearly and stick with it.
sentences.chinese: 他同时也需要和自己的对手有认同感，并且始终如一。

sentences.english: From the acquaintance, to the death, he and cherishes constantly to her sympathizing .
sentences.chinese: 从相识，至死亡，他对她的体贴和爱护始终如一。

sentences.english: The laws are, however, spottily implemented.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这些法律并非始终如一地实施。

sentences.english: Follow Jim’s advice and be consistent in pursuing your goals.
sentences.chinese: 按照吉姆的意见并且始终如一地追求自己的目标。

sentences.english: Since becoming prime minister last year, he has sketched out a consistent worldview.
sentences.chinese: 自从去年当选首相，他已拟制了始终如一的世界观。

sentences.english: There will be mutual understanding and constant physical attraction.
sentences.chinese: 有的则是相互理解和始终如一的身体吸引。

sentences.english: It remains consistent every day, and never changes its heart.
sentences.chinese: 它每天始终如一，永不变心。

sentences.english: You should always keep your domain and URL structure consistent.
sentences.chinese: 你应该保持你的域名和URL结构始终如一。

sentences.english: But whose heart is at bottom unchanging.
sentences.chinese: 可它的心在深深的海底，却始终如一。

sentences.english: Success comes from persistence and hard work.
sentences.chinese: 乐成来自于始终如一和吃苦。

sentences.english: Consistently remember the negative feelings you've experienced after overindulging.
sentences.chinese: 始终如一地记住自己过度放纵后所经历的消极感觉。

sentences.english: These countries are unable to provide basic, life-saving services in a consistent manner.
sentences.chinese: 这些国家不能始终如一地提供基本的拯救生命的服务。

sentences.english: It can be consistent and never change its heart.
sentences.chinese: 它每天始终如一，永不变心。

sentences.english: They are not striving to be better; they are attempting to be consistent.
sentences.chinese: 他们奋斗不为活的更好，他们只为始终如一而努力。

sentences.english: Your career motivation is constant and relentless.
sentences.chinese: 你的职业动机始终如一并且坚持不懈。

definition: unswerving/unflinching
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
to hold fast to/to stick to
just as in the past (idiom); as before/continuing as always
no complaints/to have no regrets
to stick to sth without change (idiom); to persevere
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
unswerving/unflinching
untiring/unremitting/indefatigable
regardless of weather conditions/rain, hail or shine
(one's) original intention, aspiration etc/(Buddhism) "beginner's mind" (i.e. having an attitude of openness when studying a subject just as a beginner in that subject would)
to become more resolute with the passing of time (idiom)
diligent and tireless (idiom)
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
